definition: the process of recognizing written or printed words and understanding their meaning
relating to the process of reading
the act of reading or studying a book, newspaper, document etc
something that you read
an event at which someone reads something to a group of people
something that someone reads to a group of people, for example at a public event or religious ceremony
a number or amount shown on a piece of measuring equipment
a particular way of thinking about a situation, statement, or event

in: My little boy is having difficulty with his reading.

reading material/matter: The prisoners have limited reading material.

definition: the skill or activity of getting information from books:
an occasion when something written, especially a work of literature, is spoken to an audience:
the way in which you understand something:

the number or amount that a piece of measuring equipment shows:
the skill or activity of getting information from written words:
Reading is also text to be read:
A reading is an occasion when a literary work or formal text is read aloud to a group of people:
